page.title: 19MARKET RASEN-A CHILD'S VIEW
page.content: This is an eleven year old girl's idea of a typical day in Market Rasen from her point of view."My name is Elizabeth and I live opposite the Race-Course. My day begins at 7 o'clock and after washing etc. my brother and I go to school. We live about 1 mile from the Primary School and mum takes us in the car. We start our school day with Assembly in the hall and the morning usually has Maths. and English. Project work usually is in the afternoon. Our school has a large hall and PE is fun. We also have a swimming pool and tennis courts which we use in the summer. My evenings are usually spent watching television but at the weekends and holidays we walk or cycle in the country. We are very lucky to have lovely open countryside all around us.I like the woods too.
